caption.p: Effect of elevated temperature on body coloration of N. viridula. Female and male insects were reared at one of five different constant temperatures (25.0°C, 27.5°C, 30.0°C, 32.5°C, and 35.0°C). Note that the insects reared at 30.0°C and 32.5°C show smaller body size and abnormal body color. No adult emergence was observed at the highest temperature (35.0°C). Download
